I‚Äôm going to introduce the No Mandates for Healthcare Workers Act, which would make this point clear to HHS that they do not have the power to enforce unilateral vaccine mandates on our healthcare workers.
I agree with Justice Thomas and am going to keep fighting. Since the Court has decided Congress has been ambiguous on this point, we‚Äôre going to make it clear.

The great Justice Thomas disagreed, saying if Congress wanted to give HHS broad vaccination power, it would have given HHS one. 

Instead the Majority found this authority in "definitional provisions.. and a provision regarding long-term care facilities‚Äô sanitation procedures.‚Äù
Within a ‚Äúhodgepodge of statutes‚Äù the Majority decided Congress has given enough authority to the President to regulate workers at healthcare facilities that accept Medicare or Medicaid.

So how did the Court get a different interpretation when it came to healthcare workers?

Largely, because you would be hard-pressed to find a hospital or nursing home that takes no money from Medicare or Medicaid.

‚ÄúPermitting OSHA to regulate the hazards of daily life ‚Äî simply because most Americans have jobs and face those same risks while on the clock ‚Äî would significantly expand OSHA‚Äôs regulatory authority without clear congressional authorization‚Äù

But a broad vaccine mandate on businesses is different than the specific, setting-based workplace safety standards. 

The Court agreed, and said Congress ‚Äúhas not given that agency the power to regulate public health more broadly.‚Äù

OSHA sets occupational safety standards based on hazards a person might face in their individual job. 

A lineman climbing a tower or a welder on an oil rig face different hazards.

Congress gave OSHA the power to set specific safety standards for both.

This week, the Supreme Court blocked one vaccine mandate but upheld another. Both are equally harmful to the economy and to getting back to normal. 

So what‚Äôs the difference? It came down to the basic question: did Congress give the President the authority to do it?
